snippet: Maria Höfl-Riesch of Germany beat the overall World Cup leader, Tina Maze of Slovenia, to win the super-combined at the Alpine skiing world championships.
abstract: Maria Hofl-Riesch beats overall World Cup leader Tina Maze to win the super combined event at Alpine skiing world championships in Schladming, Austria.
lead_paragraph: Maria Höfl-Riesch of Germany beat the overall World Cup leader, Tina Maze of Slovenia, to win the super-combined at the Alpine skiing world championships.

headline.seo: Höfl-Riesch Beats Tina Maze in Super-Combined
headline.main: A German Rushes Past Skiing’s Dominant Woman
headline.print_headline: A German Rushes Past Skiing’s Dominant Woman
